channel.title: hl2.exe has stopped working
channel.description:
I have Win7-64, Core i5 2500k @3.6ghz, 16gb ram, Geforce GTS 450, 1920x1280, nvidia driver version 306.23.
It has been years since I have run a valve game, but they ran fine. I do not currently have any other valve game / sdk installed, so I am unable to tell if these still work. I don't feel like downloading a multi gigabyte game just to see if it runs.
I first installed SDK 2007 first. for some reason this caused the SDK 2006 to download too. These are the ONLY sdk's installed.
I then downloaded BM and ran its installer. It installed into the correct folder (re: [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=13956']this post[/url]).
Inside steam, I pressed the 'Play' button and it began to launch, but showed a "hl2.exe has stopped working, please close the program' error.
As per [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=12513']this post[/url], I checked for a minidump but found that NO dump files are created. So hl2.exe isn't actually launching far enough to create its dump file.
As per [url='https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=14063']this thread[/url] i have tried the following start up options.
* -safe * -window * -window -dxlevel 90 * -window -dxlevel91 * -dxlevel90 * -fullscreen -width 1920 -height 1280 * -window -width 800 -height 600 * -safe -window
none of these options work.
I have checked these locations for steam dump files but found nothing at all (e.g. no files have been created or modified on todays date).
* c:\program files(x86)\steam\dumps * C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\sourcemods\BMS * C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\frumbert\source sdk base 2007
obviously it's working for other people, why not me?

item.title: hl2.exe has stopped working
item.dc:creator: frumbert
item.description:
Leijonasisu:

You haven’t tried to install the game & SDKs to a short file path?

eg. C:/BMS ?

In this FAQ, people have reported issues with the game complaining about non alphanumeric characters in the file-path. Especially on non-English operating systems.

Good luck.

Also read the full FAQ for more appropriate fixes. Sorry you didn’t get a reply sooner.

Um, no. I installed it using the installer, as I noted. I also noted the FAQ’s and reference posts that I have already been through, which themselves tell me to use the correct installation path (which I have, since the installer did it), and to try all the settings I listed and to verify that the sdk is installed properly and so on. Everything, as far as I can tell, says “this should work”. I have a standard Win7 X64 English non unicode operating system.
